meanings.definition: To make five times as great or as many.
meanings.sent1: She quintuplicated her cookie recipe to make enough for the whole family.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to quintuplicate their production to meet the high demand.
meanings.sent3: The magician's hat quintuplicated the number of rabbits inside, much to the audience's surprise.
meanings.sent4: His excitement quintuplicated when he found out he won the lottery.
meanings.sent5: The flowers in the garden seemed to quintuplicate overnight, creating a beautiful display.

meanings.definition: To increase or multiply by five.
meanings.sent1: The teacher quintuplicated the number of candies she gave out for solving a difficult math problem.
meanings.sent2: The population of the town quintuplicated after the opening of a new factory.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally quintuplicated the amount of salt in the soup, making it too salty to eat.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter quintuplicated as she watched the comedy show.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's speed quintuplicated as he sprinted towards the finish line.
